contents.text: Cobby and the Game of Cowabuball
Cobby the little cow moved with Mommy Cow to the island of Hippolandia.

But Cobby is not happy.

"I don't like moving to a new island," says Cobby.

Mommy Cow says, "Sometimes, I get sad about leaving the old island, too, but I will be with you every time you are feeling upset."

"And, when you are feeling upset you can always play your favorite game of Cowabubaball."

The land of Hippolandia is warm and green and filled with many creatures and inhabitants. Cobby likes his new house and his neighbors too. There is just one problem. The kids in Hippolandia don't play Cowabubaball. They play Ippominton.
Cobby can't play Ippominton very well because he can't jump very high. He tries and tries to jump as high as he can, but he just can't jump high enough to hit the Ippominton ball.
"I don't like this game because I always fail," says Cobby.

Arthur, the Alpaca, says to Cobby, "Hey, I couldn't jump very high when I began playing Ippominton. But now I can jump better."

"Think about the good feelings you have when you jump.

"So no matter how high or low you hopped, you will always feel good"

Other kids start to jump. Some kids bounce really high, other kids don't jump very high.

Cobby says to himself, "Think about the good feelings you have while you jump."

He leaps up high and notices that his body feels great when he jumps.
Cobby lands on the ground. Arthur, Bella, and Elena cheered! Cobby did not jump very high. But it felt good anyway!
Can you tell me a story?  Can you think of a time when you didn't want to exercise because you were scared you were not good enough?
Instead of feeling scared, what are some good things you can think about when you are doing that activity?
Exercising is not about being "the best" all the time. It's fun to exerise if you enjoy it time and feels good afterwards.

Chapter 2 

 Searching for a Cowabubaball
Cobby has new friends. His new friends play Ippominton every day. Cobby misses playing Cowabubaball because it is still his favorite game.

"Mommy, I want to play Cowabubaball but nobody has the ball on this island," said Cobby.

"Oh I know what I can do," says Mommy Cow.

"Tomorrow is Saturday. First thing in the morning we ask our neighbors where we can get the ball for Cowabubaball game," she says.

In the morning, Mommy and Cobby go to Ms. Kamal the Cat.

Ms. Kamal  has no idea what a Cowabubaball is. "All I have are big balls of threads," says Ms. Kamal. "But let me take you to Mr. Jose. He might be able to help you."So Cobby, Mommy, and Ms. Kamal go to Mr. Jose's house.

"I have no idea what a Cowabubaball is. I have tall boxes, but no balls," says Mr. Jose.

Then he says, "Let me take you to Dr. Evelyn, she might be able to help you."

So Cobby, Mommy, Ms. Kamal, and Mr. Jose go to Dr. Evelyn's house.
"I know what a Cowabubaball is, but I don't have any," said Dr. Evelyn. "I have a smaller ball that you can use," she says. Dr. Evelyn shows Cobby the small ball.

"Thank you, Dr. Evelyn. But this ball is too small for a game of Cowabubaball."

Dr. Evelyn says, "I know it's not as big. But playing with a small Cowabubaball is better than not playing at all."

"Yes. And you can teach us how to play Cowabubaball," says Mr. Jose.

That afternoon, Dr. Evelyn, Mommy Cow, and Cobby teach Mr. Jose and Ms. Kamal how to play Cowabubaball.

It was a small Cowabubaball, but it was fun nonetheless.

Chapter 3 

 Teaching Cowabuball

Now that Cobby has a small Cowabubaball he wants to teach his friends how to play the game. On Sunday afternoon, Cobby stops by Arthur 's house to take him for a Cowabubaball game with Bella and Dionne.

Cobby began to explain the game rules. "So to play Cowabubaball..., you have to kick the ball and run. Then you kick the ball from this pole to that pole. Let me show you how," says Cobby.

Cobbie kicks the ball and runs and kicks and runs from one pole to the another. "Now it's your turn, Bella," says Cobby.
Bella kicks the ball and runs then kicks the ball and runs. She finishes faster than Cobby!

"Arthur, it's your turn," says Bella.

Arthur kicks the ball. Then he runs. Then he stumbles. He kicks the ball again and tries to run to catch the ball. But Arthur is not a very fast runner. "I can't do this. I'm exhausted," says Arthur.
""Let me try," says Elena. She kicks the ball and runs as fast as she can. Like Arthur, she can't catch the ball. Elena doesn't run very often. "I'm exhausted! Let me take a break," said Elena.

"I'm exhausted! Let me take a break," said Elena.

"Nobody wants to play Cowabubaball," says Cobby.

"Nooo, that's not what we said," says Arthur.

Elena says, "Yes. This is a fun game. But we need a break."

"Let's do this again next Saturday," says Bella.

"Yeah, let's do this again next Saturday!" says Arthur.

In the evening, Cobbie has dinner with his mom, brothers, and sisters.

"You smiled a lot tonight. Did you have a good time with your friends?" Mommy Cow asks.

"Yes! We are going to play Cowabubaball again next Saturday."

Chapter 4 

 A New Game

It's Saturday morning. Cobby and his friends are practicing Cowabubaball again.

Bella kicks the ball to one poll, runs to catch the ball, kicks the ball to the other poll, and runs again. She can run very fast.
Arthur and Elena can't run very fast. They can't run as fast as Bella. "Cobby, I think the game isn't very  fun. Elena and I can't run very fast," says Arthur.

Bella says, "Cobbie can play Ippominton with us!"

"But he doesn't like it very much because he doesn't think he can jump very high," said Arthur.

"Why don't you just play Cowaminton?" says Mr. Jose who is standing nearby.

"What is Cowaminton?" Cobby asks.

"Cowaminton is like Cowabubaball, but not really. It's also like ippominton, but not really," Mr. Jose explains.

"Ultimately, it's part Cowabubaball and part Ippominton," says Mr. Joseto the kids.

"To play this game, one of you must run very fast and kick the ball from this pole to that pole. Then your teammate should grab the ball and throw it higher than the pole"

Cobby kicks the ball from one pole while Elena waits by the other pole. Cobby kicks the ball again for Elena to catch.

Elena catches the ball then jumps very high. She throws the ball towards the other pole. The ball flew above the pole. Way higher.

"Elena, that is so cool!" says Bella.
"This is a cool game. Let's play this again. Bella, we're a team okay?" says Arthur.

The kids of Hippolandia now play the game of Cowaminton every day.

Cobby is happy. Every day he can run faster and jump much higher. Cobby’s Mom is also happy that Cobby is happy.

This game makes Cobby feel great about himself.
